comments:

The reprot files are generated by end after the open <body> tag.

OS:
Linux paules 2.6.16.27-0.9-smp #1 SMP Tue Feb 13 09:35:18 UTC 2007 x86_64 x86_64 x86_64 GNU/Linux

JRE:
java version "1.5.0"
Java(TM) 2 Runtime Environment, Standard Edition (build pxi32dev-20070201 (SR4))IBM J9 VM (build 2.3, J2RE 1.5.0 IBM J9 2.3 Linux x86-32 j9vmxi3223-20070201 (JIT enabled)
J9VM - 20070131_11312_lHdSMR
JIT  - 20070109_1805ifx1_r8
GC   - 200701_09)
JCL  - 20070126

NOTE:  This defect requires test cases to test these report type on Linux.

Given the lateness of the i3 cycle, JScrib reports do work on Linux and BIRT is not a hard dependency of TPTP, deferring to i4.

Sheldon, please triage and provide an assessment/sizing so we can resolve this defect early next week.

I ran the BIRT reports on Linux Redhat 3.4.5 without any problems.

Can you provide me the workspace you used to generate this error.

(In reply to comment #2)
> I ran the BIRT reports on Linux Redhat 3.4.5 without any problems.
> 
> Can you provide me the workspace you used to generate this error.
> 

Sure.  Since we are blocked by 175264 on Linux, I executed a test suite (simple 'Hello World') from my SLES 10 machine to my XP Pro machine and then generated the report on the linux machine.

Created an attachment (id=67785)
Workspace

Start Eclipse from the command line with this workspace.  Note the exception in the shell after generating one of the BIRT test reports.

I was able to generate the report with the attached workspace using TPTP 4.4.0 C.

Looking at the stack trace in more detail I notice the following:
org.eclipse.birt.report.model.parser.DesignParserE xception (code =
Error.DesignParserException.UNSUPPORTED_VERSION, message : The report file of
version "3.2.10" is not supported.)

Do you know the exact version of BIRT you installed?

(In reply to comment #5)

My BIRT version was mistakenly 2.1.3.

So I reinstalled the  driver and its dependencies and used the same workspace.  This time the Test Execution Tabular Report was generated but I still get the following exception:

May 18, 2007 1:24:58 PM org.eclipse.birt.report.model.metadata.ExtensionLoader handleError
SEVERE: Message:The element type "org.eclipse.birt.chart.reportitem" is invalid. Error code:INVALID_ELEMENT_TYPE

Also, the generated test suite file does not contain any test cases (see attached).

Created an attachment (id=67821)
BIRT test report

Created an attachment (id=68405)
patch that adds loop events

The serializer did not take into account loop events.

(In reply to comment #8)
> Created an attachment (id=68405) [details]
> patch that adds loop events
> 
> The serializer did not take into account loop events.
> 

Can you remove the System.out.println statement and resubmit the patch for review?

(From update of attachment 68405)
Contains System.out debug statement

Created an attachment (id=68415)
correct patch.
Paul, can review this patch.

(In reply to comment #12)
> Paul, can review this patch.
> 

Are there other TPTP classes extending the TPFExecutionResultSerializer#recursiveVerdict(TPFExecutionHistory, TPFInvocationEvent) method?
Sheldon, can you add a test case for this symptom to the reporting test suite.

(In reply to comment #13)
> (In reply to comment #12)
> > Paul, can review this patch.
> > 
> Are there other TPTP classes extending the
> TPFExecutionResultSerializer#recursiveVerdict(TPFExecutionHistory,
> TPFInvocationEvent) method?


I am not aware of any classes extending this method.  This class is also internal.

Patch reviewed.

Please make a request to the Test Project mailing list for this defect. 

Once the fix is integrated, please add a comment to this defect containing the build ID of the driver used to verify the fix before marking the defect as fixed.

Also, can you change the review flag to '?' and add my email as the requestee.
Patch reviewed.
Applied the patch.
Verified fix in build TPTP-4.4.0-200705250100.
Reopening so originator can verify.
Fixed.
Reporter: Please verify and close in preparation for shutting down the TPTP 4.4 release.  Thanks.
Verified in TPTP-4.4.0-200706140100C.
